headline.main: LOAN TO MOSCOW PAINFUL TO TOKYO; Japanese Paper Scores U.S. Move as 'Cunning Fraud' -- Says Arms Can't Be Shipped

lead_paragraph: TOKYO, Saturday, Nov. 8 -- The American $1,000,000,000 loan to Russia, announced at the moment when Saburo Kurusu is en route to Washington as a special Japanese envoy in a final effort to obtain an easement of the economic blockade against Japan, made a rather painful impression in Japan.
